poem:
"Pace Not Place"

Stripped bare of records, diminished data,
Parkrun, where speed is now spectre.
Eliminating minutes, you accommodate 
The newest of neophytes in this world theatre.
In all our bluster, no one's lesser or great,
So we run, uncumbered by comparator.
Beyond time-ticking tyranny, we emancipate,
Simply to pulse, simply to circulate.
For entrants unending, we celebrate –
Run for the sake of run, no sedate.
